comments: Summary: an overall enjoyable, influential and interesting game pockmarked by poor design decisions, flawed development and philosophical contradictions. What I liked (* indicates a caveat - see following section): + Minecraft clearly popularized survival crafting games, for better or worse. Interacting with the environment and using it to your advantage by "mining" it and thenSummary: an overall enjoyable, influential and interesting game pockmarked by poor design decisions, flawed development and philosophical contradictions. What I liked (* indicates a caveat - see following section): + Minecraft clearly popularized survival crafting games, for better or worse. Interacting with the environment and using it to your advantage by "mining" it and then "crafting" with it is the essence of the game and it is a relatively fresh concept. + There is a decent amount of content*(1). + The game clearly lends itself to co-operative multiplay, which I enjoy. Players have had some success with PvP due to novel situations you can get into with the mechanics, though I find it rather unsophisticated overall. + Minecraft will get you to think both creatively and geometrically. Mining and farming are matters of tiling, a classic category of math problems, based on a few facts you will learn contingently in-game. This encourages problem-solving skills not normally required in video games. Meanwhile, building aesthetic structures allows the player to express themselves in-game instead of following a railroad path so familiar to many modern games. + Item progression is relatively exciting and satisfying*(2). + Technically speaking, Minecraft is interesting for a number of reasons. It wasn't anywhere near the first game to use voxels in graphics and gameplay so extensively, but it popularized their use. Voxels are a kind of "atomic" graphical structure that constructs larger shapes out of smaller particles, not unlike LEGOs. Until Minecraft, they were mostly used outside of gaming for things like molecule imaging. Minecraft used fairly remarkable terrain generation algorithms to procedurally generate fresh worlds made out of voxels for each playthrough. + There is so much to do*(3), and the player can set their own pace. The game can be played in short bursts or in massive marathons and it lends itself to being rather addictive. What I didn't like: - *(1): There is a lot of content, but the way in which it is accessed is poorly conceived. Due to the terrain generation, most new content that comes in the form of new block types or new items needs to be reached by approaching the frontiers of what has already been discovered; for middle-to-old-aged worlds this can be several kilometers away from the starting point for a mere chance at visiting the new content. For instance, I easily have over 1000 hours in the game, and the "mushroom island" biome type was added to the world 4 1/2 years ago. I still have never encountered it. This flaw in the terrain generation algorithm forms the basis of several tedious game struggles later on, like finding a Nether fortress or village (necessary to acquire Eyes of Ender, items used to locate the final boss and "End" biome), finding biomes that were introduced years ago to experience all the content, or even finding content that is new to biomes that you've already experienced. - *(2): In the beginning of the game, there's a clear material progression as you advance through wood->stone->iron->diamond tools and armor. After this point, though, all progression comes in the form of using a rather contrived enchantment system that is frankly an inconvenience. Since this enchantment system requires wheat, sugar cane, cows, and trees you're somewhat limited to where you want to put your "base" unless you feel like traveling a great distance to visit your cows or want to try leading them across great expanses (the pathing AI is not that great). Even then, once you have gone through the bother of acquiring the 46 leather, 90 wood planks, 135 sugar cane, 4 obsidian, and 2 diamond necessary to max out enchantment (yes I know this off the top of my head), it becomes increasingly expensive to repair your super-items. - *(3): Most tasks in the game are about resource collection of some kind. There is combat and exploration but it is very lackluster. Once you've seen an example of something you've really seen it all. The rest of the game is about gathering resources, and this can be tedious. A few years ago one of the developers actually intentionally made crops slower to mature, not because he thought the game was too easy but just to make everything more tedious. Mining can take minutes upon hours of your time doing repetitive tasks to get modest gains, even when you meticulously plan it in a statistically favorable way and perfect all your equipment. - Many ancient bugs, like poor achievement detection and Nether portal calculation, persist to this day. - Numerous promises have been left on the floor: a modding API, more weapons than a sword or bow, a living villager economy, off the top of my head. - Devs are less imaginative than modders and have been spending the better part of 5 years inserting inferior versions of mods as patches. - The recent combat update adds more hackneyed decisions, hamstringing the player in pointless ways.…

Single player survival can be boring after a bit. after issue is the online player base should you not have any online friends, as it's mostly 12 year old scum, 6 year old try hards, and 30 something people riding that youtube money train. Voice chat would be nice, as way too many times have i and others been killed before we could speak. Another thing is the nature of the game, as it runs off java, which for those 12 and under, was a basic programming code and a old 3d web browser game thing like flash was for 2d stuff. Java by this point has gone senile, a glitch randomly occurring which basically bricks your game, preventing little timmy from smashing his mother's acer facebook machine like a very colorful pinata... oh hell, that would still happen. Honestly, if you have some friends and wait a bit for 1.10's java issues, minecraft would be a blast, but if you're looking for a fun single player or online with randos experience, looking elsewhere would be advised.…

Minecraft was a game based on Open-World building originally, though in recent years it has been made more into a Garry's Mod-esque game with people building gamemodes and mods to add onto the original game. This adds to the replayability a lot, and drastically increases the variety in things you can do in the game. This is the main reason Minecraft has gotten so popular in recent years, the amount of creativity you can express in this game is immense, from mods to your own creations using in-game blocks. comments: I used to absolutely love this game, it had a simple concept, simple graphics, and the ability to do anything. But looking back, this game has gone down a crappy road thanks to Microsoft/Mojang and the Minecraft community itself. Let's start with what Microsoft did wrong after buying it from Markus Pearson: The 1.9 and update. Dear lord, this update basically ruined the combat part ofI used to absolutely love this game, it had a simple concept, simple graphics, and the ability to do anything. But looking back, this game has gone down a crappy road thanks to Microsoft/Mojang and the Minecraft community itself. Let's start with what Microsoft did wrong after buying it from Markus Pearson: The 1.9 and update. Dear lord, this update basically ruined the combat part of the game. For starters the removed the ability to craft god apples, which although is little disappointing, but I can live without it. Also, they made it so you can't spam the left click button when in combat anymore, which may take some time getting used to, but it would probably be good to balance the combat. So why did I just mention these 2 things if they don't actually bother me? Well... I'm not sure. BUT, the thing that does bother me is that the axes are now more powerful than all of the swords. Even a axe made of wood has equivalent power of a sword made of diamonds. Because of this tweak, the swords are completely pointless in crafting/using! Also, Microsoft/Mojang didn't actually add any new weapons to a update called: "The Combat Update". Which means to this day, Minecraft still only has 11 weapons... 10 of which are melee weapons. Now, let's see what the community did wrong: #1: The multiplayer severs, If you go on the internet to look for 100% vanilla Minecraft servers with no plugins/mods whats so ever, you'll relise there's no such thing anymore. All you'll ever see now is stupid minigames and "factions severs". Which although may seem fun at first, it eventually gets boring as hell. #2: The god awful and super annoying fanbase, where do I begin? The Youtube videos, the music parody's, videos of 6 year-olds, the Minecon convention (yes, they made a yearly convention just for 1 stupid video game), and many more. So cancerous, so stupid, so many "please make it stop" feelings. At the end of all of it, there are some good parts of the game, such as the singeplayer experience and... well, that's about it. Thank you for reading my review.…

comments: Minecraft, Minecraft, Minecraft. What can you really say about this game that hasn't already been said? Nonetheless, let me outline some things that I like about it: and sometimes I'll "compare" it to Terraria since I like that game too. Story: good joke m8 Controls: Simple and intuitive: move with WASD, M1 for attack, M2 for other action, other keys for open inventory, drop itemMinecraft, Minecraft, Minecraft. What can you really say about this game that hasn't already been said? Nonetheless, let me outline some things that I like about it: and sometimes I'll "compare" it to Terraria since I like that game too. Story: good joke m8 Controls: Simple and intuitive: move with WASD, M1 for attack, M2 for other action, other keys for open inventory, drop item and swap hands. Simple, but it's a good simple. Graphics: Nice classic pixel art style: default textures are nice, but if you don't like them, USE A FREABKING RESOURCE PACK. Sound: Ambient music that only plays occasionally compared to Terraria's upbeat, constant music. Really sets the tone nicely. The sound effects also help: random creepy echoes if you're near a cave with monsters in it etc. Gameplay: Arguably the most important part of any game. And Minecraft does not disappoint. Simple to learn, simple concept, but you can do literally anything as long as you put in the time to do it. There are tons of different biomes to explore and discover. There are dungeons to loot and monuments to conquer. You have a combat system that appears simple: swipe when the meter's full to deal the most damage: but there's more depth with slower, but heavier-hitting axes, potions, using a shield to block your opponents attack: it's not complex, but it's pretty deep all things considered (but I still wouldn't say it's as fantastic as fighting giant eyes in Terraria). And then there's the thing you've all been waiting for: the building. What can you say about it? Put in the time to make the build, and you can create something truly special: even a computer. Yes, a computer. Conclusion: Great, calming game that you can easily play for hours on end: perfecting your mob trap, finishing up and decorating your mansion, you name it, you can do it. Cons: it can get pretty repetitive, and you might even say boring, but it's easy to just start a new project, make a new world, and you can just keep on playing. (The community also isn't that great but you can't fault the game for that, can you?) (Surely Undertale and FNAF can agree with me, right?) In comparison to Terraria: they're both great games in their own rights, but they focus on different things. Terraria focuses more on exploration & combat, Minecraft focuses on creating things. Side note: I don't play too much multiplayer on public servers so that experience may be completely different: I'm just there for the survival.…

By exploring theMinecraft, quite simple can be described as a game where a person moves blocks around to build things and goes on adventures. Through some research and discussions with my peer’s I am learning that there is more to the game than I had originally thought. Using Minecraft in the classroom can become a huge incentive for students that struggle and need that extra push to do well and develop a love for learning. comments: Old school graphics, excellent design, that’s what make Minecraft a one-of-a-kind game. Everything is made of “blocks” just like an 8-bit game but it is much smoother. It has an incredible concept and is available on Google Play, the App Store, PS4, Xbox One, and many desktop computers. But a downside is it’s not free, for the mobile version it is $6.99 and for the computer version in isOld school graphics, excellent design, that’s what make Minecraft a one-of-a-kind game. Everything is made of “blocks” just like an 8-bit game but it is much smoother. It has an incredible concept and is available on Google Play, the App Store, PS4, Xbox One, and many desktop computers. But a downside is it’s not free, for the mobile version it is $6.99 and for the computer version in is $27.99. It has fairly simple controls on every platform and exciting gameplay. Minecraft is suitable for all ages and with a multiplayer function, the whole family can join a world and have hours of fun. I personally have Minecraft on all available platforms: Ipad-mobile, desktop computer-computer, and Xbox one-console. I first got Minecraft on an old Kindle Fire tablet, and the first hour I spent playing the game, was figuring out how the controls and all the other stuff works. When you first load Minecraft for the first time there is no tutorial but the controls are quite simple. Another thing I enjoy is the different “Mob”, monster, mechanics. With one Mob exploding and another one shooting arrows at me, it definitely created a fast pace in-game. About a year after I got the pocket edition, sometimes referred to as the mobile version, I decided to purchase the computer version and let me tell you, it was ten times better than the pocket edition (I’m not saying that the pocket edition is bad). With many more features than the pocket edition it provided much more entertaining gameplay. I haven’t spent much time on the Xbox one version, but of what I have seen has told me that it is worth your money. With easy access to multiplayer options the console version would suit an online player nicely. With all that being said, if you are a gamer and want a fun, action packed game but with simple graphics, then this should be a definite choice. The cost can be something that makes you not want to get this game, but after you have created an account, you can download it to virtually any computer. If you have a question about the gameplay, graphics, etc, just leave a comment and I’ll be sure to respond.…

comments: Minecraft is definitely a masterpiece in the survival genre. In Survival Mode, you're put in a huge randomly generated world with almost no pointers or directions. Your only goal is to survive. This game does a great job at making you feel vulnerable, as encountering a monster can easily result in you dying and dropping all of your items. All tools and armor will eventually break, you canMinecraft is definitely a masterpiece in the survival genre. In Survival Mode, you're put in a huge randomly generated world with almost no pointers or directions. Your only goal is to survive. This game does a great job at making you feel vulnerable, as encountering a monster can easily result in you dying and dropping all of your items. All tools and armor will eventually break, you can break and collect almost any block, and you can craft items with materials you find. Other than surviving, there isn't really anything your aiming to do (although you can come up with your own goals if you want), you're just constantly exploring and getting more materials. Despite the lack of end-goal, exploring, mining, and surviving doesn't need one, which I'm still not 100% sure on why. Then there's Creative Mode if you want to just build instead of surviving. This is where the graphics work to the game's advantage, as the size of the blocks makes building easy and simple, but still capable of producing detailed structures if they're big enough. Also, if those blocks were more detailed, it wouldn't fit aesthetically considering the world is made of blocks. Command Blocks also allow you to change certain aspects of the game, allowing you to create your own maps with unique rules. Due to this, you can make almost anything despite the use of blocks, and that's a testament to the game's creative potential. Whether you want to build or survive, this game has a lot to offer to you, and it's easy to see why it became so popular, especially since it keeps improving with updates.…

Despite, this, Minecraft does feel bare at times, and for an open-world survival game, many of the game elements such as combat and enemies do get tiring fast. Minecraft is an entertaining game, easy to jump into at any time, but the experience that it offers isn't quite as revolutionary that many make it out to be.…

comments: As the top 3 biggest selling game, Minecraft has exponentially grown in the past 8 years it has been around. Since 2009, Mojang has been making the game better for people of all ages to ease into the gaming world by entering through the gateway to gaming (Even your grandma could learn the controls it’s that simple). This game, like no other, features key aspects which make it stand out toAs the top 3 biggest selling game, Minecraft has exponentially grown in the past 8 years it has been around. Since 2009, Mojang has been making the game better for people of all ages to ease into the gaming world by entering through the gateway to gaming (Even your grandma could learn the controls it’s that simple). This game, like no other, features key aspects which make it stand out to any other game on the market. The graphics on this game give most people a nostalgic throwback to the 90’s playing around in an 8-bit graphic sandbox but very creatively blended in with modern day shaders to make this game look like the mona lisa painted on an 8 bit colour palette. The game doesn’t need a story. Your keyboard and mouse make the story. Nobody knows where this character ‘Steve’ came from, but he is the only human to exist, surrounded by a vast world of 60 million square meters (Bigger than Earth!) which can be sculpted by your very own bare hands. The game features very ambient distinct music, which soothes any moment from running away from creeper in a mineshaft or just building your house to survive the first night. What makes this game special on computer is that it can be run on most modern day computers, ranging from the Intel Pentium laptops to the monster rig you got your grandma to buy you for Christmas to play a 90’s doom sandbox game. You even get the choice to play earlier versions of the game for more compatibility, not mentioning that the game is almost on every platform makes it very easy to get your hands on. However, in the recent years Mojang has come up with ideas to possibly make this game any better, but they have somewhat failed to do so. I think the game is complete and needs no further updates. Minecraft doesn’t need anything more to it, and every time they add new features to the game they are making it harder to gain an expanding audience. There also doesn’t need to be a market. Micro transactions are not the way to go. I wouldn’t mind buying the game for extra money to not get irritated by Microsoft’s scheme of an ingame currency to buy skins that has always been free to PC JavaScript version users. Overall, I think that Minecraft should not be improved and the game remains a piece of history in the museum of gaming which has changed the perspective of people who don’t see success in game if it doesn’t have ‘intense 4K texture graphic rendering’ and pay attention to the unique features of a game that has different features to the triple A games we have today.…

comments: (Vanilla review) Minecraft is a great concept that never realized its full potential. It has fun exploration, combat, and sandbox gameplay that make it stand out. However, it suffers from a lack of polish and content. There are about 15 different kinds of enemies in the game, which is odd considering the variety of biomes. Combat is limited to swords and bows. There are only 5(Vanilla review) Minecraft is a great concept that never realized its full potential. It has fun exploration, combat, and sandbox gameplay that make it stand out. However, it suffers from a lack of polish and content. There are about 15 different kinds of enemies in the game, which is odd considering the variety of biomes. Combat is limited to swords and bows. There are only 5 tiers of tools/armors/weapons. Crafting also feels limited and item stack sizes are only 64. Bosses seem rushed and untested. The Ender Dragon is very difficult even on easy mode. There are several "grindy" parts of the game. For example, enchanting costs levels to perform, and even enchanting 2-3 items can take 1-4 hours of level grinding. To get to The End the first time requires 14-16 ender pearls which drop from a rare enemy. To summon the Wither boss requires 3 wither skulls which are a very rare drop from a very rare enemy. Spent $27, played 180 hours, not recommended because there are better sandbox games.…

comments: Minecraft is a sandbox game made by Sweden’s Mojang AB and 4J studios. Minecraft’s special point is that the game basically has no rules! Each time you enter into a new world, you are in a different map made by different blocks which can be destroyed and built into whatever you like. This freedom is what makes Minecraft a magical game - it gives you enough space and resource to create aMinecraft is a sandbox game made by Sweden’s Mojang AB and 4J studios. Minecraft’s special point is that the game basically has no rules! Each time you enter into a new world, you are in a different map made by different blocks which can be destroyed and built into whatever you like. This freedom is what makes Minecraft a magical game - it gives you enough space and resource to create a world as you see fit. You can enjoy creating your own crazy ideas, exploring the world and completing your own map. Another special point is that the game obeys scientific principles to make the game world seem more real. For example, if you use the lighter on the tree, the tree will be burnt; if you cut a sand block down, other sand blocks over it will fall down. The fact that everything in the world acts as how you would expect it to be gives you a more natural game experience. Minecraft is really an awesome game that anyone can enjoy. It is great both as a single player game or as a party game that you can play with your friends. By yourself, you can mold your own special world; with friends, you can fight in a fighting map. No matter the situation, you can get a lot of enjoyment out of the game. Minecraft is also a game that can be enjoyed by players of all ages. Young kids can practice their ability of innovation through creating different things. Adults can stay out of the stress during the time they are playing this game. People of different ages can find different things to enjoy from the game, and this is what makes Minecraft suitable for both the young and old.…

comments: A good game that you shouldn't buy. Indeed, in this game lies the potential of greatness, a potential that would have to be unlocked by yourself nonetheless. However, while it proably deserves your time, it does not deserve your money for a number of reasons wich can be summed up quickly : the stupidity, greed and laziness of the devellopers. Now let's make a list of the detailed issuesA good game that you shouldn't buy. Indeed, in this game lies the potential of greatness, a potential that would have to be unlocked by yourself nonetheless. However, while it proably deserves your time, it does not deserve your money for a number of reasons wich can be summed up quickly : the stupidity, greed and laziness of the devellopers. Now let's make a list of the detailed issues : 1. The devellopers are too stupid to programm a game correctly : There's no denying it, the way that this game has been coded is very amateurish, the fact that it runs on java is a dead giveaway. The game is very poorly optimized and for its poor graphics, uses a lot of superfluous resources from your computer, if you want to play it in a way that gives you an acceptable viewing range or relatively pretty graphics to admire your creations , be prepared to use a very beefy computer and forget about playing it that way on the go. 2. The devellopers are too stupid and morally corrupt to fix a BUG : If you want to make a functioning, complex piston machine there's one thing that will f*ck you over : the "quasi-connectivity" BUG, a BUG wich defies logic (because it's a BUG, duh), in the way that it creates unpredictable leaps of activation by redstone, in short, it goes against the principle of this game wich is "block by block" (not my words indeed, as the the official name of a Minecr*ft charity project is "block by block initiative"), and instead adds a whole bunch of nonsensical "rules" wich kill a lot of possibilities. Now, you surely want to ask, why do I stress the word "BUG" like a r*tard ? Well, it's simple, after this BUG was discovered, like with any BUGS, people started to exploit it to create new possibilities, and that is normal, however the ret*rded devellopers decided not to fix the bug and insted "make" it (make as in makebelieve) a "feature" (no, I'm not kidding you https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MCPE-14664). I consider this to be the proof of two things : a huge part of the minecraft community (best exemplified by this person https://youtu.be/aRdcptG365I?t=105), as well as the dev team are completely ret*rded and morally corrupt. You have to be either one of these things at an extreme or both if you think that a BUG wich breaks the game, could not a) be replaced by an actual separate FEATURE of the game b) not be given priority in every version of Minecr*ft, and instead be kept for those who absolutely need it in older versions, or even, god forbid, become optional (yes, yes, 10 years olds, its mind-blowing) 3. The devellopers need an eternity to create simple updates Updates for this game take several months to be realeased. That would be nothing unusual if the updates wouldn't consist of pretty much nothing. for example between november 2016 and June 2017 (1.11 and 1.12), the only major changes were better coloration and a turorial. If you want more evidence that the devellopers are lazy, look no further than the big layers of fat wich envellop Markus Persson's body, who, if you didn't already know, is the founder of Minecraft and has stopped working on it a while ago to sell it for 2.5 billions $ to Micro$oft and, thus proceeded to do, and still does, nothing all day. Considering this, you might agree that it would be amoral to buy this game, because I don't think it is really necessary for some incompetent nobodies to cash in on an idea that was made 10 years ago while seldom producing anything of worth. F*ck the lazy and stupid programmers, f*ck Micro$oft, f*ck the ret*rds that defend this game, and download a cracked version on the internet. Cheers.…

Now they've removed or changed everything that used to be good, and turned it into something worse. Examples are different map sizes (now it's only infinite, flat or old), movement (speed and comfort, now it glides in a way that it didn't before, and placing blocks in a row, it now can't keep up, but just suddenly stops). On top of all this, they didn't change anything but the basic "add new blocks, add new textures" etc... Basically Minecraft is an exact copy of the game it was at launch, with incredibly minor changes. One would think that microsoft would be able to make wonders when they took over, but they have really only turned it into a cash-grab mess. It's a shame when you think about what Minecraft could've became after all these years!…

comments: I bought Minecraft in 2013. I just stopped playing it this year, in 2018. 5 YEARS. That is how long I spent on this game. And the only mods I have ever used are Optifine and the Epicarno Mod. It says a lot about how much this game can offer. Now for my review of everything in the game. The Graphics: I hate the idiots who say: “MInEcraFT HAs bAd GraPhICs, sO I HatE It sO mUcH!” TheI bought Minecraft in 2013. I just stopped playing it this year, in 2018. 5 YEARS. That is how long I spent on this game. And the only mods I have ever used are Optifine and the Epicarno Mod. It says a lot about how much this game can offer. Now for my review of everything in the game. The Graphics: I hate the idiots who say: “MInEcraFT HAs bAd GraPhICs, sO I HatE It sO mUcH!” The graphics are a matter of personal preference, but since resource packs exist, that argument is kind of invalid. I don’t what your situation is, but I personally enjoyed the aesthetic of the game. The Story: Non-existent in a good way. Next! The Combat: The basic combat is pretty complex stuff, as you can tailor your playstyle around a variety of weapons. There are swords (basic, everyday weapons), axes (high damage, slow speed), pickaxes (breaks armour faster), bows (ranged alternative), and most recently, tridents (throwing weapons). The Building: The best gameplay aspect. Tons of blocks, infinite possibilities. I don’t see why people would hate on Minecraft other than to make themselves look cool. (I know, the community sucks. But that isn’t the game itself, that is the people playing it. Jeez.) Plus, the holy grail of all blocks, the Command Block, is in the game. You can essentially use Minecraft code in order to summon monsters, give yourself items, and even change how the game plays. The imagination really is your only limit. The Multiplayer: Mojang (and Microsoft), have pretty bad server connection. It can take ages to log onto servers for some people. I never really ran into this though, and my internet isn’t the stuff of your wildest dreams. The servers are amazing in this game, and I have made many friends by playing on servers such as Hypixel and Cubecraft. Basically, this game has actually changed my life and changed the way I think. This masterpiece deserves the 10/10. My only complaint is that Microsoft seems to add trivial features all of the time.…

Also, the community is one ofMinecraft used to be a perfect game, a 10/10 for me. This was before Microsoft stepped in and completely f****d everything up. Instead of the updates adding necessary features to the game, now, they feel completely unnecessary. The prime example for this would be the unnecessary texture changes that for a huge majority, look worse than the original textures. Also, the community is one of the worst game communities of all time. However, if you look at Minecraft as a whole, it is still a damn good game. There are few games that really make you feel like the world is really yours like Minecraft does. And, despite having simplistic graphics, the game is incredibly immersive and has a very believable world even with the gravity defying physics and the fact that you can build a portal to "Hell." Minecraft is one of the first PC games I ever played and still remains as my favorite open world survival game, it's just the recent changes and the community that bogs it down from being 10/10 for me.…

During a thunderstorm, beds can also be used regardless of time. Attempting to use a bed at any other time will result in the message "You can sleep only at night and during thunderstorms". The player must be close to the bed to sleep. If the player is close enough to click on the bed, but not close enough to sleep in it, the message "You may not rest now, the bed is too far away" will be displayed. In Bedrock Edition, the message "Bed is too far away" will be displayed. The player cannot sleep if a "monster" is within 8 blocks of the bed horizontally (along each axis) and 5 blocks vertically. If a monster is nearby, even through a wall, the message "You may not rest now, there are monsters nearby" will be displayed and the player will not be able to sleep (even in Creative mode[Legacy Console Edition only]) until the monsters leave or are killed. Most hostile mobs, with the exception of some, as well as some neutral mobs, will prevent players from sleeping. The table below shows if the mob prevents or does not prevent the player from sleeping.…

Es una forma divertida de pasar horas de juego a comparación con otros títulos que abarcan``Debo ser Honesto...´´ Este título Sandbox salio para la PC en el 2009, con el objetivo de darle al jugador la oportunidad de construir, diseñar estructuras, plataformas, y llenar a gusto el mundo en el que se encuentra nuestro personaje principal. Dándole un concepto básico, son legos digitales. Es una forma divertida de pasar horas de juego a comparación con otros títulos que abarcan el género de construcción, éste tiene muchos aspectos a favor y facilidades en la jugabilidad, inventario y diseño que lo hacen atractivo y cómodo para el jugador. Sin embargo no demora mucho en encontrar cualquiera de sus numerosas fallas: funciones defectuosas características incompletas, una completa falta de multijugador, terrible inteligencia artificial, y para colmo, a pesar de su extenso mapa sandbox, el juego es ridículamente corto… ¿Dónde está el reto en todo esto? No es secreto para nadie que este título se convirtió en un Juego de Culto y una pieza importante en la comunidad gamer y la cultura pop. Minecraft es sin duda un juego revolucionario que ha dejado su lugar en la historia. Anque la audiencia de un juego no determina la calidad del juego. En este caso a mi parecer, no aporta nada, aparte de pasar un buen rato. Jugabilidad: 7/10 Personajes: 3/10 Historia: -/10 Diseño: 6.5/10 Entretenimiento: 8/10…

comments: Ok this may seem generic but Minecraft is a simple, fun and inviting game to play for people of all ages. for those few people who have not played this brilliant game this how its structured. You had 2 game modes: Survival where your goal is to collect material build kill and survive. There are enemy's like creepers and spider but there are also zombies and skeletons which can only spawnOk this may seem generic but Minecraft is a simple, fun and inviting game to play for people of all ages. for those few people who have not played this brilliant game this how its structured. You had 2 game modes: Survival where your goal is to collect material build kill and survive. There are enemy's like creepers and spider but there are also zombies and skeletons which can only spawn at night. That's the basics. And then there is also Creative where you cant die and you have infinite everything where you can make whatever you want to your hearts content without worrying about dying or enemy's (or mobs as they call them). They are both fun game modes but that's not all. There are also chances to play with friends either on the same console or online, plus there are things called servers that were made by people so that you can play minigames or other activities that they have designed. The graphics are a good call back to the 8-Bit graphics of the NES, and the gameplay is smooth and the controls are even better with them being simple to use and understand. Overall if your looking for a fun sometimes family friendly game then this perfect for you. There is no wonder why its one of the best selling games of all time…

comments: This is definitely one of the best games I have ever played. There are two modes, creative and survival. The survival mode is where you have limited resources around the map and must go and mine, craft dig and shovel, etc and if you have enabled “easy, medium, hard” you must fight monsters that try to go near you. The creative mode, in which I like more is the easy version where you do notThis is definitely one of the best games I have ever played. There are two modes, creative and survival. The survival mode is where you have limited resources around the map and must go and mine, craft dig and shovel, etc and if you have enabled “easy, medium, hard” you must fight monsters that try to go near you. The creative mode, in which I like more is the easy version where you do not have to worry about these things and can do whatever you want in the game like building a farm or a castle! The hardcore mode of the game is where things get really difficult, because once you die, your world gets deleted and you have no chance of respawning. There are also mini games on the Wii U, Xbox, and PS4 versions of the game called Tumble, Battle and Glide. Tumble is a free game which is basically spleef, where you use shovels and snowballs to make players fall off the platform. The last standing person wins. Battle is basically like hunger games, just with less players and smaller map size. Depending on how many players are in the game, the maps will expand to fit that amount of players. You go find items such as swords and bows and use them to defend yourself from other players. Battle royals, last one standing wins. Glide Is by far the least fun, however it still can be really fun on your own. The glide mode requires a lot of practice and you use wings to glide and navigate your way around the map until you reach the finish line. There are boosters hidden around the map that allow you to take shortcuts or get that extra speed boost. With other players it is a race. You can customize your character in the form of skins(some you have to pay for on all versions) or create your own on the Pc or Pocket editions. Other players on the pc version can start servers where you can find other people and mini games. The most popular are Hypixel, Lifeboat, anything pvp related and much more.…

comments: Игрок постепенно начинает уставать играть или мотать на ус как выживать в купленной версии МАЙНКРАФТ. Моды с нашего сайта — вам помогут разнообразить процесс игры и его гемлей. Установите моды — вы сможете приискать что-то себе. Сами моды они меняют стиль игры или добавляют для вас что-то интересное. Благодаря этому вам нравится игра и вы стараетесь увлекаться ею большое,Игрок постепенно начинает уставать играть или мотать на ус как выживать в купленной версии МАЙНКРАФТ. Моды с нашего сайта — вам помогут разнообразить процесс игры и его гемлей. Установите моды — вы сможете приискать что-то себе. Сами моды они меняют стиль игры или добавляют для вас что-то интересное. Благодаря этому вам нравится игра и вы стараетесь увлекаться ею большое, продолжительное время — разбирая постройки с друзьями:). Существует много вариаций и разнообразий в модах — список версий уж долго перечислять он всегда пополняется! Например сейчас хит — это версия 1.14 модов в майнкрафт. На каждую версию мода найдется свое дополнение — вы и ваши друзья, должны учитывать, определится какую версию вам нужно скачать! Наш майнкрафт сайт с модами — на нем можете легко найти то что вам нужно и установить это! Я уверяю вас — вы можете быть спокойны за свой телефон андроид, или айфон, даже с компьютером будет все в порядке, каждый файл-мод проверяется администрацией! Плагин-что это? Так подумает обычный человек, который за всю игру не играл с друзьями на других серверах. А вдруг играл, но он ведь даже его не заметил, ведь регистрируешься ты часто и зайдя на сервер ты по привычке и зарегистрировался, а ведь это тоже плагин. Только его устанавливают владельцы серверов, к которым можно подключиться без лицензии. Плагин-это дополнение устанавливаемое на серверную часть, и в отличие от мода, вам не требуется его устанавливать на свой пк и что-то настраивать. Очень часто, маленькие и незначительные моды можно перенести в плагине и не потребуется установка например - мод что добавляет нам надгробия, был перенесен на плагин и теперь вам не нужно перед игрой заходить и скачивать данный мод. Но есть и свои крупные нюансы например в моде вам будет показана красивая могила, а в плагине нельзя добавлять текстуры, а значит она будет состоять из сундука и внутри будут ваши вещи. Из этого делается вывод Plugin- полезная единица для дополнения мира, но направленная на практичность.…

comments: Super Mario 64, Tetris, Pong, and Minecraft. These are some of the most revolutionary and best games in all of history. Minecraft's core mechanic is simple, you can build blocks and you can break them. Even with a mechanic so simple, the possibilities are nearly endless. There are two modes, survival and creative. Survival is a game mode where you have to build to survive the night, youSuper Mario 64, Tetris, Pong, and Minecraft. These are some of the most revolutionary and best games in all of history. Minecraft's core mechanic is simple, you can build blocks and you can break them. Even with a mechanic so simple, the possibilities are nearly endless. There are two modes, survival and creative. Survival is a game mode where you have to build to survive the night, you have hunger and health to worry about, and your main goal is to defeat the Ender Dragon. But this isnt the only thing you can do. You can explore the seas for treasure, explore for rich temples, and even more! Survival is pretty fun but it takes alot of time to gather materials, You can also try creative mode. Creative allows you to do anything, build a giant castle, create unbeatable mobs, or blow up entire mountains! That not even a chunk of what you can do in creative mode. Minecraft is a masterpiece, no other game will ever come close to how revolutionary this game is. This game proved to the gaming industry that one simple mechanic can express the upmost creativity and imagination. This game is a must-play, and 100% worth your money. I would recommend grabbing some friends and starting a survival world (or realm) together.…

comments: Credo MInecraft sia l'emblema di ciò che il concetto di "Open World" rappresenta, in quanto sia probabilmente uno dei pochi, se non l'unico, titoli in grado di rispondere letteralmente al termine che lo descrive: Mondo Aperto. Minecraft ha riscosso così tanto successo all'epoca del suo lancio, e la riscuote tutt'ora a ben 10 lunghi anni dal suo rilascio, grazie all'infinità, nel VEROCredo MInecraft sia l'emblema di ciò che il concetto di "Open World" rappresenta, in quanto sia probabilmente uno dei pochi, se non l'unico, titoli in grado di rispondere letteralmente al termine che lo descrive: Mondo Aperto. Minecraft ha riscosso così tanto successo all'epoca del suo lancio, e la riscuote tutt'ora a ben 10 lunghi anni dal suo rilascio, grazie all'infinità, nel VERO senso della parola, di modi con i quali è possibile trasformare la propria esperienza di gioco, sia nella versione vanilla (Non modificata), sia tramite l'ausilio di mod, plug in o custom maps. La fantasia del giocatore è messa alla prova: cerchi un luogo dove sprigionare le tue capacità ingegneristiche? Vuoi provare a mettere alla prova le tue capacità di sopravvivenza in un ambiente surrealmente ostile la notte quanto apparentemente infantile durante il giorno? Vuoi allenare le tue skill di combattimento all'arma bianca virtuale senza il bisogno di sfoggiare complicate combo? Vuoi semplicemente fare esplodere dei maiali in un laboratorio ignifugo sottoterra? Accomodati pure. Markus Persson ti ha preceduto. Un altro punto a favore, fra i tanti, di Minecraft è la gestione che Microsoft ha esercitato dopo l'acquisizione del brand. Invece di abbandonare il progetto e semplicemente intascare i ricavati di un prodotto non suo, lasciandolo al suo destino, la multinazionale si è presa l'effettivo carico di proseguire il progetto adoperando risorse non indifferenti, portando sempre qualcosa di nuovo ai fedeli videogiocatori, con patch consistenti ed innovative (Anche se, personalmente, non ho apprezzato molto la 1.14, ma questo è un parere strettamente personale). E la community, a sua volta, ha dimostrato agli sviluppatori il loro sostegno aumentando le possibilità ludiche del gioco tramite mod e creazione di minigames online... Un gioco da provare, almeno una volta nella vita.…

comments: Faut-il encore présenter l'indémodable Minecraft, sortie en 2011, toujours probablement le maître du genre survie bac à sable. La seule limite finalement dans ce jeu, c'est la créativité du joueur, ce qui fait véritablement sa force, sans compter sur le fait que Minecraft est extrêmement complet, et peut se vanter, plusieurs années après sa sortie, avoir une communauté énorme et active,Faut-il encore présenter l'indémodable Minecraft, sortie en 2011, toujours probablement le maître du genre survie bac à sable. La seule limite finalement dans ce jeu, c'est la créativité du joueur, ce qui fait véritablement sa force, sans compter sur le fait que Minecraft est extrêmement complet, et peut se vanter, plusieurs années après sa sortie, avoir une communauté énorme et active, notamment au vu des mods qu'il est possible d'ajouter, et qui enrichi toujours un peu plus l’expérience, bien que le vanilla soit déjà bien croustillant. Il est vrai qu'il y en a pour tous les goûts, que ce soit la construction, les systèmes de redstone, l'élevage, la culture de nourriture, l'exploration et j'en passe, le joueur a de quoi toujours s'occuper, que ce soit en solo ou sur l'un des nombreux serveurs existants. Si graphiquement le jeu peu paraître repoussant au premier abord, par son côté cubique et visuellement « dépassé », on apprend pourtant à s’émerveiller devant certains décors générés de manière procédurale. Par ailleurs, bon nombre de shader sont disponibles pour améliorer grandement les graphismes, à condition d'avoir une configuration qui le supporte. Minecraft reste aujourd’hui une valeur sûre du jeu vidéo.…

comments: Este juego podría ser maravilloso. Podría. De verdad, por que es un juego que podria haberle dado muchísima mas nota. La exploración es de lo mejorcito que hay en un videojuego (a pesar de estar algo desaprovechado, ya que el juego no te premia mucho por explorar en la superficie, sino en las cuevas, haciendose algo repetitivo el siempre minar, crear un mejor pico, minar, crear un mejorEste juego podría ser maravilloso. Podría. De verdad, por que es un juego que podria haberle dado muchísima mas nota. La exploración es de lo mejorcito que hay en un videojuego (a pesar de estar algo desaprovechado, ya que el juego no te premia mucho por explorar en la superficie, sino en las cuevas, haciendose algo repetitivo el siempre minar, crear un mejor pico, minar, crear un mejor pico, etc...) y los gráficos son un autentico logro. Sin embargo, el hecho de que una vez sobreviví mas en dificultad hardcore que en fácil demuestran que las opciones de dificultad están muy mal hechas. Este juego es muy difícil. Sumado a la falta de tutorial, hacen que este juego no logre atraer nuevos jugadores. Sumémosle el pésimo rendimiento en algunas computadoras, la falta de mapa al principio del juego, y las pseudo mecánicas de RPG que creo que debieron de haberse aprovechado mejor. Es bastante frustrante también el full loot de este juego, es decir, ¿Inclusive si estoy jugando en fácil solo por toparme con un Creeper o minar para abajo me muero de una y pierdo todos mis items? Que mierda! Debería ser opcional! Muchas veces me tocaron mapas sin algún item importante como mapas sin ovejas ni vacas. Si pasa eso, estas jodido. El juego no tiene objetivos ni una explicación y lo único que lo salva es la exploración mediocre que tiene por las "mediocres" mecánicas jugables. El control de salto es malo y la dificultad con la falta de un tutorial para craftear lo mata. Necesitaría también un bestiario y algo para ver los items ya hechos o algo por el estilo. También critico el hecho de que las versiones de consola son superiores a la versión de PC, teniendo por ejemplo un multijugador a pantalla partida. De verdad que este juego podría haber sido muy divertido! Tiene un gran potencial! Pero las cagadas que se mandaron son muchas y graves. Pudo haber tenido mas nota, como también menos. Son opiniones personales. De todas formas, tiene un 5. Tiene puntos positivos y fuertes! No es un mal videojuego. Minecraft es muy disfrutable. Puedo recomendarlo? Claro que si! Tendrá un 5, pero hay gente que disfrutara el modo creativo, la exploración y una profundidad en la jugabilidad, única de este juego :)…
author: sebastianali

comments: This is another review in which I wish to come clean on. This isn't necessarily a bad game in the sense that I still DO play it today; I just don't often like how it works (and that's mainly why I'm giving it that low a score) - the argument you can build anything you imagine is only half true in this game as for my argument. This only applies to form, never to function, in the mostThis is another review in which I wish to come clean on. This isn't necessarily a bad game in the sense that I still DO play it today; I just don't often like how it works (and that's mainly why I'm giving it that low a score) - the argument you can build anything you imagine is only half true in this game as for my argument. This only applies to form, never to function, in the most technical sense. For example, you'd be hard-pressed to build a working excavator, at least not a life-like one, in Minecraft - it's impossible due to how the game works! On a less obvious note, a castle wouldn't be of much use, at least not in the traditional sense. This is because there's none of the traditional factors of a castle: people to work in it and protect it, a king to rule it, enemies to attack it, and soldiers to guard it. The lack of dynamics and such in the game's mechanics (including redstone) is arguably the game's weakest point - and definitely my biggest gripe with the game - in a game where you're expected to be able to build anything you can imagine. Some players actually view this as a game, and it falls short on satisfying that sector of gamers. The community is also a mess, and that is in fact how I became a negative person at one point. Obviously, I brought this on myself in the end ultimately, but I could still hardly blame myself if I became this way due to the community. It often spoke about doom and gloom, not to mention trolls, and this was especially so in the dark ages of Minecraft, back in 2014 - 2018(?). I shouldn't even have to mention that if you found today's micro-transactions more of genuine scams and less of game features, I would argue that the problem is 10x worse on Minecraft servers - where the rules are often twisted to prevent you from ever standing a chance in minigames, concurring a situation where you have two choices - where you either have to live with it, or pay up, meaning that you often have to pay to even enjoy the minigames, let alone succeed in it. Overall, the game had a lot of potential, but I feel was marred by Mojang's haphazard direction on the game itself and the lack of concern for ever providing a solid goal and point in the game, not to mention Minecraft servers that are arguably 10x worse than traditional pay-to-win mobile games, which I bet Mojang never really took into consideration as well. Now, again, this is certainly not to say that I'll won't be playing Minecraft - in fact, I still do enjoy the game to an extent. I just feel like things could've been done a whole lot better for this game, and in a world where we expect the latest and greatest today, we're not seeing any of that advancement with Minecraft, really. If you're wondering why you get bored of worlds in Minecraft and start new ones instead of spending months much less years on worlds, this should be enough information for you. Pret-ty disappointing, if you ask me. If only Mojang were "Craft-y" to begin with. In fact, this game and its flaws and current flaws especially, are the impetus for a MC mod I've been working on that plans to not only bring dynamics to this game, but provide a meaningful point and viewpoint to this game, among other things that should make Minecraft tick all the boxes it needs to. I'm putting all my hope into the success of this mod, and hopefully it will provide y'all all the stuff y'all ever wanted and needed in this game. Cheers.…
author: Dream_Imp_Luna

comments: Bair and switch. A game that constantly teases you. Like playing an MMO offline.. the moment you ask for more and turn off creative mode, you are reminded that there isnt.. in fact.. a game to play. Just a creative mode that turns off creativity with its very existence. Creative mode - excellent, you have already spent hours upon hours building your masterpieces. Even the worst dig youBair and switch. A game that constantly teases you. Like playing an MMO offline.. the moment you ask for more and turn off creative mode, you are reminded that there isnt.. in fact.. a game to play. Just a creative mode that turns off creativity with its very existence. Creative mode - excellent, you have already spent hours upon hours building your masterpieces. Even the worst dig you ever did was amazing. You can enjoy every cave. Every formation, every landscape can be turned into something it isnt. Or something more. Or less. Dont like that mountain? Get rid of it. Mountain not high enough? Build it to the sky. Survival mode : ... there isnt any survival to speak of. Hunger meter in a game where there is no varied food items, but you can cook cow and pig all day long and.. it is too simple. Combat: atrocious. Your enemies have infinite ammo and no reason to hunt you. Animals attack suicidally. Skeleton archers pursue you to hell and back because... nothing. Creepers spawn when you sit still and improve your home. Or dig and make a tunnel safe and well lit. Believabiliy: None. There is no motif to the enemies. Just a hodgepodge of garbage. Unique biomes are nice, but never expanded upon with unique enemies or unique formations.. You have had YEARS TO ACTUALLY FIND A MOTIF TO BUILD UPON! So all in all, Minecraft is a zero. The mod community made the game, not the developers. Mods make a game, and this one is like a cult classic.. the movie sucks but the audience can collectively point fingers at your steaming pile of crap and laugh as a group.. so much like being sent away to an awful place, it isnt the destination but the people you go with that are the 10/10. Go die, Mojang. Lets Play'ers on youtube made you.…

comments: After a decade and becoming the most sold game ever (and f**k me, this thing has as many re-releases than skyrim), all they have really done is add some more pretty colourful toys that gets boring after the 10th use. They barely explore the redstone & haven't explored survival at all. If anything they've made survival easier and less fulfilling. All you need to completely nullify theAfter a decade and becoming the most sold game ever (and f**k me, this thing has as many re-releases than skyrim), all they have really done is add some more pretty colourful toys that gets boring after the 10th use. They barely explore the redstone & haven't explored survival at all. If anything they've made survival easier and less fulfilling. All you need to completely nullify the danger is a shield and a bed. Year after year of "Here's some pretty static things, some useless mobs, and MAYBE a re-texture of the old pyramids and strongholds. Please stick around to buy merch and micro-transactions". So much potential depth & complexity un-used for the sake of not upsetting the kiddies because we need to milk the most sold game ever. I started playing this game threw the free browser version where you just had a static pallet and honestly, not much has changed except for a thew shallow/unexplored features. The only real value this game has is for modding the hell out of it & playing with friends, and it isn't all that well optimized for it. When Microsoft bought Mojang some people where worried that it would become a basic, shallow, soulless husk and we all called them crazy. But look back now, they where right.…

I've been playing it constantly and I never get bored of it. It has a unique style of having a blocky look with pixels that you can see individually look great. It’s one of the few video games that are enjoyable and has simplicity. In Minecraft, there are two main modes, survival and creative. In survival you spawn with nothing but you’re bare hands and you have to make a living with the things around you, this may include breaking trees to get wood, farming animals for food, or even going in caves near lava to find diamonds, the games most valuable resource. In creative mode, you spawn with an inventory that has unlimited supplies and utilities, you can even fly around! With both of these modes, friends can join in and you can both have fun. Minecraft is the world's best selling game with over 180 million copies of the game sold. Anyone will find something in this game that they love!…

Minecraft is a blocky game and the goal of the game is to beat the Ender Dragon. The Ender Dragon is a black and purple dragon that rules the END. After beating the dragon a portal opens in the middle where the dragon lands once in while for attacks.I would rate the game MINECRAFT a 5/5 or more if I could. I would give it this rate because it’s one of the BEST games I’ve ever played. Minecraft is a blocky game and the goal of the game is to beat the Ender Dragon. The Ender Dragon is a black and purple dragon that rules the END. After beating the dragon a portal opens in the middle where the dragon lands once in while for attacks. After entering the portal you will come across a credits screen notifying you that you beat the game. You can install mods and add-ons to the game to make it more fun. On the Xbox version, you can join online lobbies to play different games. On the PS version, you can play a game mode similar to online mode except you can only play with the players on the same screen. Speaking of the same screen Minecraft is a 4 player game. Every time a person joins the screen splits. You can do different modes such as Creative, survival, and online mode. Lastly, Minecraft is available on Xbox360 and Xbox1, PS4 and Ps3, PC (computer), mobile, and Nintendo Switch.…

comments: No matter how good the games made in the next decades or centuries, none will reach the feet of minecraft, no game gives you more freedom and autonomy than this game, you build your story from the beginning to the "end" that it's actually just a representative point of what your power limit would be inside, but in my opinion this is just your real beginning in the game, without anyNo matter how good the games made in the next decades or centuries, none will reach the feet of minecraft, no game gives you more freedom and autonomy than this game, you build your story from the beginning to the "end" that it's actually just a representative point of what your power limit would be inside, but in my opinion this is just your real beginning in the game, without any limitation you build your own finals delimiting your own milestones and learning more and more about the masterpiece, because there will always be something more to do in minecraft; no game to date has managed to arrive at such a beautiful concept but at the same time simple about "open world", it is not just a world, it is an infinite place that you shape your way and you can always discover more things no matter the theme, is a game that from your first until your last update will keep you evolving more and more and it will never get boring, just because your possibilities are endless and you will never reach a point where the game has already offered you everything it had to give; minecraft has built such a close-knit community over the years that it has always been faithful, supported new players and always found ways to innovate, and even with simple graphics, simple mechanics and a simple concept, minecraft, a game that has been around for over a decade, always gave us that "I want more" feeling.…

comments: Achei que seria uma porcaria, mas estava enganado. A criatividade do maluco que inventou isso é desumana. O game já apresenta um modo sobrevivência com possibilidade infinitas. Você pode fazer o que você quiser, e no tempo que você bem entender. Os inimigos são icônicos, o gameplay é extremamente divertido, e no desenrolar do game, você acaba gostando da experiência. Mesmo tendo umaAchei que seria uma porcaria, mas estava enganado. A criatividade do maluco que inventou isso é desumana. O game já apresenta um modo sobrevivência com possibilidade infinitas. Você pode fazer o que você quiser, e no tempo que você bem entender. Os inimigos são icônicos, o gameplay é extremamente divertido, e no desenrolar do game, você acaba gostando da experiência. Mesmo tendo uma fanbase realmente podre, ainda assim é um jogo muito bom e bem explorado. Com objetivos legais, um mapa divertido e uma mecânica com um texto muito bem escrito e dirigido. Por mais que o gráfico seja horrendo, isso não me incomodou, inclusive eu acho que a ideia era fazer um gráfico desta maneira e resultar num jogo bom, tipo Undertale, mas isso é outro assunto... de qualquer forma, eu gostei do game, mesmo sendo maçante, repetitivo, gráficos péssimos, cenários simples e mal abordados, ele ainda é divertido, e isso é o que importa.…
